required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Testing the Efficacy and Safety of the WEI Nasal Jet
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of the WEI Nasal Jet

brief_summary.textblock: Testing the efficacy and safety of the WEI Nasal Jet.

detailed_description.textblock: This is only initial thought and suggestions from the inventor Dr. Huafeng Wei. Principal investigator from each medical center interested in testing this new device should design their own clinical trials based on patient population and their own ideas for clinical trials. Just remind you that patient safety is number one and try all efforts to minimize patient risks during your clinical study.

primary_outcome.measure: lowest SaO2 in Wei JET group
primary_outcome.description: Compare with Control group,there was no significant difference in lowest SaO2 in Wei JET group.

biospec_descr.textblock: â€¢Patients receiving various types of surgeries under sedation, especially for procedures of colonoscopy, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) cystoscopy and other brief surgeries you are interested in the study.

study_pop.textblock:
Suggested patient inclusion criteria:
Patients receiving various types of surgeries under sedation, especially for procedures of colonoscopy, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) cystoscopy and other brief surgeries you are interested in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients receiving various types of surgeries under sedation, especially for procedures of colonoscopy, upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) cystoscopy and other brief surgeries you are interested in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with coagulopathy and tendency of nose bleeding.
- Patients with any diagnosed cardiac diseases (e.g. cardiac failure, angina, MI, cardiac arrhythmia. etc.)
- Patients with any diagnosed pulmonary disease (e.g. asthma, COPD, pulmonary embolism, pulmonary edema etc.)
- Pregnant patients
- Patients with liver failure
- Patients with kidney failure

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
